title: What is CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery)?
variants: An attack where an attacker tricks a user into sending unwanted requests on their behalf
A method of protection against attacks using cookies
A type of server attack aimed at crashing the database

title: What is XSS (Cross-Site Scripting)?
variants: An attack where an attacker injects malicious code into a page to be executed in the victim's browser
A web application protection system against unauthorized access
A method of data encryption

title: How can you prevent XSS vulnerabilities?
variants: By using HTML entities for all input data
By ignoring input validation
By enabling an ad blocker extension on the site

title: What is SQL Injection?
variants: An attack where an attacker inserts malicious SQL queries into user input
A process of speeding up database queries
A method of encrypting user passwords

title: How can you prevent SQL Injection?
variants: By using parameterized queries
By not validating input data
By using less powerful databases

title: What is HTTPS and why is it needed?
variants: A protocol for protecting data transmitted between client and server
A data compression system to speed up the site
A method to simplify user authentication

title: Which of the following statements is correct for password protection?
variants: Passwords should be stored in plain text in the database
Passwords should be encrypted or hashed with a salt
Passwords can be left unprotected if they are short

title: What is the JWT authentication mechanism?
variants: A method of message encryption
A protocol for user authentication and authorization in an application
A vulnerability scanning algorithm
